sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>few</radical> members of society without <radical>power</radical> suffer from severe <kanji>inferiority</kanji> complexes. Most people in this world have lots of power, so the few that do not feel quite inferior. It is this feeling of inferiority that fuels their inferiority complexes.
meaningInfo: Imagine you are one of the few without power. Feel the inferiority crushing down on you. It feels terrible and there is nothing you can do about it.
readingMnemonic: Since you suffer from such extreme feelings of <kanji>inferiority</kanji>, when someone offers you and your friends the chance to gain power, you yell “<reading>Let’s</reading> (<ja>れつ</ja>) go!” without a second thought. “Let’s go, guys! Come on! Power awaits us!”
readingInfo: Let’s go, let’s go! Time’s a wastin’! I’m tired of this inferiority and want to gain some power!
